definition: to confer a title upon sb/to dub/to crown/to invest with rank or title
book/booklet/classifier for books
surname Feng
to confer/to grant/to bestow a title/to seal/classifier for sealed objects, esp. letters

sentences.english: In the history of drama, it is primarily canonized for its stylistic innovations.
sentences.chinese: 在过去的历史话剧，这主要是册封的文体创新。

sentences.english: Anybody who set himself up as king, without being appointed king by the Senate, that was itself an act of treason.
sentences.chinese: 任何人自称为王，而不受元老院册封，那就是叛国罪。

sentences.english: Father, for my sake, knight him this day.
sentences.chinese: 父王，看我的薄面，今日册封他为骑士吧。

sentences.english: The coronation is only two days away. I fear this will not be ready in time.
sentences.chinese: 离册封大典还有两天，我怕我绣不好。

sentences.english: Wanli emperor decided was conferring the king of Japan.
sentences.chinese: 万历帝决定册封丰臣秀吉为日本国王。

sentences.english: I hereby proclaim the Empress coronation will take place on the fifteenth day of this month.
sentences.chinese: 传朕口谕，本月十五，举行皇后册封大典。

sentences.english: Zhao light and a good dancer, pet crown Temple, canonized as after.
sentences.chinese: 赵轻盈善舞，宠冠后宫，册封为后。

sentences.english: In 1972 he was made a Knight Commander of St.
sentences.chinese: 1972年被教皇册封为圣格里高利骑士指挥官。

sentences.english: However, it is now used in my coronation.
sentences.chinese: 没想到，却要用在我的册封大典上。

sentences.english: Eventually, Joan of Arc was made a saint in 1920.
sentences.chinese: 贞德最后于1920年被册封为圣人。

sentences.english: He has remarkable feats in motherland's unification, and was canonized as the Prince by Qing Dynasty.
sentences.chinese: 由于维护祖国统一的功勋卓著，被清王朝册封为郡王。

sentences.english: It was the first time the association has held a public investiture Mass for its postulants in Hong Kong.
sentences.chinese: 这是该骑士团首次在香港举行公开的册封仪式。

sentences.english: He was conferred marquess by the king.

definition: to receive fief and title/to be enfeoffed/(fig.) to be rewarded by the emperor
to confer a title on (an empress or a prince)
to seal up (a door with a paper seal, or a document)/to confer an additional title on a nobleman
to confer a title/to ennoble/to knight/title of nobility
to appoint sb to a post or confer a title on sb by imperial order
to confer a posthumous title
to ascend the throne
to succeed to the throne
to have an audience (with the Emperor)
honorific title/form of address reserved for a queen, ancestor, emperor etc
order of feudal nobility, namely: Duke 公[gong1], Marquis 侯[hou2], Count 伯[bo2], Viscount 子[zi3], Baron 男[nan2]
to depose (a king)
to act as regent
to succeed to the throne/accession
heir apparent to a throne
to have an audience with
